p: Our study reported six isolated sesquiterpenes from essential oil and from extracts of the heartwood of Pilgerodendron uviferum. Additionally, we showed that two of these sesquiterpenes (âˆ’)- trans-calamenene ( 1) and cadalene ( 2), as well as the essential oil and DCME extract, were effective in reducing the adult growth of Hylastinus obscurus, a major red clover pest. The chemical composition from the heartwood of P. uviferum may potentially be useful in future biological control programs as a means to control the crop damage to T. pretense that is caused by this global pest.
